oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Morris-Jumel Mansion
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Houses; Dwellings; Revolutions; Military headquarters; Presidents
Military headquarters; United States -- History -- Revolution, 1775-1783;Washington, George, -- 1732-1799.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Morris-Jumel Mansion served as Washington's headquarters during the American Revolution. After Washington lost the Battle of Harlem Heights, the British established headquarters in the home. The Greek Revival style mansion is Manhattan's oldest surviving house.
